CalculatedPropertiesSpecification.description: Sub-specification to include additional calculated properties into the content.

label.description: Label of the calculated property. May be localized.

priority.description:
Priority of the property. Determines the position of this property in UI
components - higher priority means the property should be more visible.
Defaults to `1000`.

value.description:
ECExpression used to calculate the value. The
following symbol sets are available:
- ECInstance ECExpression context
- Ruleset variables

CheckBoxRule.description:
Rule that allows configuring check boxes for certain nodes.

Is also allows binding check box state with boolean properties by setting `propertyName` parameter.
If `propertyName` is not set, then `defaultValue` is used for default check box state.

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order to execute it. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

defaultValue.description:
Default value to use for the check box state

Note: Only makes sense when *not* bound to an ECProperty.

isEnabled.description: Indicates whether check box is enabled or disabled.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

propertyName.description:
Name of boolean type ECProperty which is bound with the check box state. When set,
property value gets bound to checkbox state.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

useInversedPropertyValue.description:
Should property value be inversed for the check box state.

Note: Only makes sense when bound to an ECProperty.

ChildNodeRule.description:
Child node rules define nodes that are displayed at
each child hierarchy level.

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order to execute it. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

customizationRules.description:
Customization rules that are applied for the content returned by
this rule.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

specifications.description: Specifications that define what content the rule returns.

stopFurtherProcessing.description:
Stop processing rules that have lower priority. Used in cases when recursion
suppression is needed.

Note: If this flag is set, `specifications` and `subConditions` are not processed.

subConditions.description:
Specifies child node rules which are only used when specific condition
is satisfied.

ClassGroup.description: Allows grouping ECInstance nodes by their base class.

baseClass.description: Specification of the base ECClass to group by. Defaults to rule's class.

createGroupForSingleItem.description: Should the grouping node be created if there is only one item in that group.

ContentInstancesOfSpecificClassesSpecifi.description:
Creates content for ECInstance(s) of specified classes.

Note: this specification doesn't rely on selection. It always returns instances no matter
what the selection is, so pre-filtering should be done in `ContentRule` condition and `instanceFilter`.

classes.description: List of ECClass specifications whose ECInstances should be selected.

handleInstancesPolymorphically.description: Whether to get content from instances of derived `classes`.

handlePropertiesPolymorphically.description:
Whether to get content from properties of derived `classes`. If `true`, properties from `classes` with no instances
do not appear in the result set.

instanceFilter.description:
Condition for filtering instances of defined classes.

See: ECExpressions available in instance filter

priority.description: Defines the order in which specifications are evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

propertyCategories.description:
Specifications for custom categories. Simply defining the categories does
nothing - they have to be referenced from `PropertySpecification` defined in
`propertyOverrides` by `id`.

relatedProperties.description: Specifications for including properties of related instances

showImages.description: Should each content record be assigned an image id

ContentModifier.description:
Rule that allows supplementing content with additional
specifications for certain ECClasses.

class.description:
Specification of ECClass whose content should be supplemented.
The modifier is applied to all ECClasses if this property
is not specified.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

propertyCategories.description:
Specifications for custom categories. Simply defining the categories does
nothing - they have to be referenced from `PropertySpecification` defined in
`propertyOverrides` by `id`.

relatedProperties.description: Specifications for including properties of related instances

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

ContentRelatedInstancesSpecification.description:
Creates content for ECInstance(s) related to current selection.

Note: Use `ContentRule.condition` to apply specification on correct selection.

instanceFilter.description:
Condition for filtering instances targeted by specified relationship paths.

See: ECExpressions available in instance filter

priority.description: Defines the order in which specifications are evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

propertyCategories.description:
Specifications for custom categories. Simply defining the categories does
nothing - they have to be referenced from `PropertySpecification` defined in
`propertyOverrides` by `id`.

relatedProperties.description: Specifications for including properties of related instances

relationshipPaths.description: Relationship paths from input (selected) instance class to content class.

showImages.description: Should each content record be assigned an image id

ContentRule.description:
Defines content that's displayed in content controls (table view,
property pane, etc.) and the content that's selected in
unified selection controls

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order to execute it. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

specifications.description: Specifications that define content returned by the rule

description.description: Description of the node. May be localized.

doNotSort.description:
Set this flag to `true` to suppress default sorting of ECInstances returned by this specification.

Note: setting this flag to `true` improves performance.

hasChildren.description:
This tells the rules engine that nodes produced using this
specification always or never have children. Defaults to `Unknown`.

Note: setting this flag to `Always` or `Never` improves performance.

hideExpression.description:
An ECExpression which
indicates whether a node should be hidden or not.

hideIfNoChildren.description: Hide nodes if they don't have children.

hideNodesInHierarchy.description:
Hide instance nodes provided by this specification and directly show nodes of its children.
This helps if you need to define related instance nodes of particular parent node that is not available in the
hierarchy.

imageId.description: Id of the image to use for this custom node.

label.description: Label of the node. May be localized.

priority.description: Defines the order in which specifications are evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

relatedInstances.description: Specifications of related instances that can be used in nodes' creation.

suppressSimilarAncestorsCheck.description:
Suppress similar ancestor nodes' checking when creating nodes based on this specification.

By default we stop creating hierarchy at the node that has a similar ancestor representing
the same ECInstance and created using the same specification to prevent creating infinite
hierarchies. With this flag enabled, we allow up to 10 similar ancestors before we consider
the hierarchy infinite.

CustomQueryInstanceNodesSpecification.description:
Creates nodes for instances which are returned by an ECSQL query.

Note: this specification is formerly known as `SearchResultInstanceNodesSpecification`.

doNotSort.description:
Set this flag to `true` to suppress default sorting of ECInstances returned by this specification.

Note: setting this flag to `true` improves performance.

groupByClass.description: Group instances by ECClass. Defaults to `true`.

groupByLabel.description: Group instances by label. Defaults to `true`.

hasChildren.description:
This tells the rules engine that nodes produced using this
specification always or never have children. Defaults to `Unknown`.

Note: setting this flag to `Always` or `Never` improves performance.

hideExpression.description:
An ECExpression which
indicates whether a node should be hidden or not.

hideIfNoChildren.description: Hide nodes if they don't have children.

hideNodesInHierarchy.description:
Hide instance nodes provided by this specification and directly show nodes of its children.
This helps if you need to define related instance nodes of particular parent node that is not available in the
hierarchy.

priority.description: Defines the order in which specifications are evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

queries.description:
Specifications of queries used to create the content.

Note: if more than one search query is specified, the results get merged.

relatedInstances.description: Specifications of related instances that can be used in nodes' creation.

suppressSimilarAncestorsCheck.description:
Suppress similar ancestor nodes' checking when creating nodes based on this specification.

By default we stop creating hierarchy at the node that has a similar ancestor representing
the same ECInstance and created using the same specification to prevent creating infinite
hierarchies. With this flag enabled, we allow up to 10 similar ancestors before we consider
the hierarchy infinite.

DefaultPropertyCategoryOverride.description:
A rule that allows overriding the default property category.

The default property category is a category that gets assigned to properties
that otherwise have no category.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

DisabledSortingRule.description:
Rule to disable sorting for certain ECInstances in the hierarchy and/or content.

Note: Disabling sorting increases performance

Note: This rule is not meant to be used to sort grouping nodes, custom nodes or
other non ECInstance type of nodes.

class.description:
Specification of ECClass whose ECInstances should be sorted by this rule.
Defaults to all classes in current context if not specified.

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order to execute it. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

isPolymorphic.description: Should `class` defined in this rule be handled polymorphically.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

ECPropertyValueQuerySpecification.description:
Specification which specifies the name of the parent instance property whose
value is the ECSQL used to query for instances.

Precondition: can be used only if parent node is ECInstance node.
If there is no immediate parent instance node it will go up until it finds one.

class.description: Specification of ECClass whose instances the query returns.

parentPropertyName.description:
Specifies name of the parent instance property whose value
contains the ECSQL query.

Warning: the property whose name is specified must be of string type.

ExtendedDataRule.description:
Rule used to inject some extended data into presentation data
objects (nodes, records).

A couple of typical use cases:
- Table is showing models and elements polymorphically and application
   wants to handle all models and all elements differently. The rule can be used
   to inject some flag that tells whether table row represents a model or an element.
- Tree shows a hierarchy of models and elements. Then element node is clicked,
   application needs to additionally know element model's ID. The rule can be used
   to inject that ID into element's node.

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order for it to be used. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

items.description:
A map of items that define the values stored in the extended data structure.

The key part of the pair should be unique within all keys which are used for specific
presentation object, even if they are applied using different `ExtendedData` definitions.

The value part of the pair is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols and whose
evaluated result is used as the value of the extended data item.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

GroupingRule.description:
Grouping rule is an advanced way to configure node grouping.

It allows to define these types of groupings:
- Group by base class.
- Group by any property of the instance by a common value or a range of values.
- Group multiple instances with the same label in to one ECInstance node. This can be used in cases when these
instances represent the same object for the user.

The rule works in conjunction with other grouping options available in navigation specifications `ChildNodeSpecification`:
`groupByClass` and `groupByLabel`. The grouping hierarchy looks like this:
- Base ECClass grouping node (specified by base class grouping specification `ClassGroup`)
   - ECClass grouping node (specified by `groupByClass` property)
     - ECProperty grouping node 1 (specified by 1st `PropertyGroup`)
       - ECProperty grouping node 2 (specified by 2nd `PropertyGroup`)
         - ECProperty grouping node n (specified by n-th `PropertyGroup`)
           - Display label grouping node (specified by `groupByLabel` property)
             - ECInstance nodes (may be grouped under a single node by `SameLabelInstanceGroup`)

class.description: Specification of ECClass which should be grouped using this rule

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order to execute it. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

groups.description: Specifications of grouping which should be applied to matching ECInstances

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

IdCategoryIdentifier.description: Identifier of a category specified through `PropertyCategorySpecification` in this scope.

categoryId.description: ID of the category pointed to by this identifier

ImageIdOverride.description:
Rule that allows overriding default icon and dynamically define an icon
for a particular node based on the context.

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order to execute it. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

imageIdExpression.description:
Defines an image ID that should be used for nodes that meet rule condition. This is
an ECExpression, so ID can be
defined/formatted dynamically based on the context - for example ECInstance property value.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

InstanceLabelOverride.description:
Rule to override labels for instances of specific ECClasses.

Important: Prefer this rule over `LabelOverride` when possible as it
has better performance.

class.description: Specification of the ECClass to apply this rule to.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

values.description:
Specifications for the label value. The first non-empty value
is used as the actual label.

InstanceLabelOverrideBriefcaseIdSpecific.description: Specification that returns ECInstance's briefcase ID in base36 format.

InstanceLabelOverrideClassLabelSpecifica.description: Specification that uses ECClass display label as the label content.

InstanceLabelOverrideClassNameSpecificat.description: Specification that uses ECClass name as the label content.

full.description: Should full (`{schemaName}.{className}`) class name be used

InstanceLabelOverrideCompositeValueSpeci.description:
Specification that allows creating a label value composited using
multiple other specifications.

parts.description:
Parts of the value.

If any of the parts with `isRequired` flag evaluate to an empty string, the
result of this specification is also an empty string.

spec.description: Specification to define how the label for `InstanceLabelOverride` should be created.

separator.description: Separator to use when joining the parts. Defaults to a space character.

InstanceLabelOverrideLocalIdSpecificatio.description: Specification that returns ECInstance's local ID in base36 format.

InstanceLabelOverridePropertyValueSpecif.description: Specification that uses property value as the label content.

propertyName.description: Name of the property whose value should be used.

propertySource.description:
Path from `InstanceLabelOverride.class` to the property class. If omitted,
`InstanceLabelOverride.class` is used as property class.

InstanceLabelOverrideRelatedInstanceLabe.description: Specification that uses label of a related instance as the label content.

pathToRelatedInstance.description:
Path from `InstanceLabelOverride.class` to the class of related instance whose label
should be returned.

InstanceLabelOverrideStringValueSpecific.description: Specification that uses the specified value as the label content.

value.description: The value to use as the label content.

InstanceNodesOfSpecificClassesSpecificat.description: Creates nodes for all instances of specified ECClasses.

classes.description: Specifications of ECClasses whose instances should be returned.

doNotSort.description:
Set this flag to `true` to suppress default sorting of ECInstances returned by this specification.

Note: setting this flag to `true` improves performance.

groupByClass.description: Group instances by ECClass. Defaults to `true`.

groupByLabel.description: Group instances by label. Defaults to `true`.

hasChildren.description:
This tells the rules engine that nodes produced using this
specification always or never have children. Defaults to `Unknown`.

Note: setting this flag to `Always` or `Never` improves performance.

hideExpression.description:
An ECExpression which
indicates whether a node should be hidden or not.

hideIfNoChildren.description: Hide nodes if they don't have children.

hideNodesInHierarchy.description:
Hide instance nodes provided by this specification and directly show nodes of its children.
This helps if you need to define related instance nodes of particular parent node that is not available in the
hierarchy.

instanceFilter.description:
Condition for filtering instances of defined classes.

See: ECExpressions Available in InstanceFilter.

priority.description: Defines the order in which specifications are evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

relatedInstances.description: Specifications of related instances that can be used in nodes' creation.

suppressSimilarAncestorsCheck.description:
Suppress similar ancestor nodes' checking when creating nodes based on this specification.

By default we stop creating hierarchy at the node that has a similar ancestor representing
the same ECInstance and created using the same specification to prevent creating infinite
hierarchies. With this flag enabled, we allow up to 10 similar ancestors before we consider
the hierarchy infinite.

LabelOverride.description:
Rule to override labels and descriptions of nodes which pass rule's
condition.

Important: Prefer `InstanceLabelOverride` over this rule when possible as it
has better performance.

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order to execute it. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

description.description:
Defines the description that should be used for node. This is
an ECExpression, so
description can be defined/formatted dynamically based on the context - for example
ECInstance property value. May be localized.

label.description:
Defines the label that should be used for node. This is
an ECExpression, so label
can be defined/formatted dynamically based on the context - for example
ECInstance property value. May be localized.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

MultiSchemaClassesSpecification.description:
Specification for multiple ECClasses that belong to
the same ECSchema.

classNames.description:
List of ECClass names.

Each class name may be prefixed with:
- `E:` to exclude class from results
- `PE:` to exclude class and all its sublasses from results
So generally the list may contain `["base_class_name", "PE:derived_class_name"]` to
include all instances of `base_class_name` except all polymorphic instances of
`derived_class_name`.

NoCategoryIdentifier.description:
Identifier for no category. Used to make category displayed at root level by using
this identifier for `PropertyCategorySpecification.parentId`.

NodeArtifactsRule.description:
Rule used to create and assign artifacts to specific nodes. The artifacts can be
accessed when evaluating parent node's `hideExpression` to decide whether it should
be hidden or not.

A typical use case:
- The hierarchy consists of *Subject* nodes and each *Subject* may or may not have child *Model* nodes. There are 2 types
of *Models*: *A* & *B*, we want *ModelA* nodes to be visible and *ModelB* ones to be hidden. We want *Subject* node to be
visible only if it has a *Model* (either *A* or *B*). In this case we can't use `hideIfNoChildren` flag on *Subjects*, because
a *Subject* node may only have a related *ModelB* which means *Subject* doesn't have children and should be displayed as a leaf node.
The solution is to use `NodeArtifacts` on the *ModelB* nodes and a `hideExpression` on *Subject* nodes. The expression can access
artifacts created by child *ModelB* nodes: `NOT ThisNode.HasChildren AND NOT ThisNode.ChildrenArtifacts.AnyMatches(x => x.IsModelB)`

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order for it to be used. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

items.description:
A map of items that define the values stored in the artifacts data structure.

The key part of the pair should be unique within all keys which are used for specific
presentation object, even if they are applied using different `NodeArtifacts` definitions.

The value part of the pair is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols and whose
evaluated result is used as the artifact value.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

ParentCategoryIdentifier.description:
Identifier of the default parent category.

For direct properties it's the default category. See `DefaultPropertyCategoryOverride` for overriding the default category.

For related properties it's the category made up from the related ECClass defined by the last
`RelatedPropertiesSpecification` with `RelationshipMeaning.RelatedInstance`. If there's no such specification,
the default category is used.

PropertyCategorySpecification.description: Specification to define a custom property category.

autoExpand.description: Should this category be auto-expanded. Defaults to `false`.

description.description: Optional extensive description of the category.

id.description: Category identifier which has to be unique at the scope of it's definition.

label.description: Display label of the category. May be localized.

parentId.description:
Identifier of a parent category. When specified as a `string`,
the value acts as an `IdCategoryIdentifier`. Defaults to `ParentCategoryIdentifier`.

priority.description: Priority of the category. Higher priority categories are displayed on top. Defaults to `1000`.

PropertyEditorJsonParameters.description: Arbitrary JSON parameters for custom property editors

json.description: Arbitrary JSON that can be handled by a property editor

PropertyEditorMultilineParameters.description: Multiline parameters for property editors that support multiline display

PropertyEditorRangeParameters.description: Range parameters for property editors that support ranges

PropertyEditorSliderParameters.description: Slider parameters for property editors that support slider display

max.description: Maximum value that can be set.

min.description: Minimum value that can be set.

PropertyGroup.description:
Allows grouping by property of the instance
by a common value or by range of values.

createGroupForSingleItem.description: Should the grouping node be created if there is only one item in that group

createGroupForUnspecifiedValues.description:
Should a separate grouping node be created for nodes whose grouping value is not
set or is an empty string.

Defaults to `true`.

groupingValue.description:
Should the instances be grouped on display label or the grouping property value.
Defaults to `PropertyGroupingValue.DisplayLabel`.

Note: Grouping by property value is required if the display label is
overridden to display grouped instances count.

Warning: Grouping by label and sorting by property value is not possible.

imageId.description: ID of an image to use for the grouping node

propertyName.description: Name of the ECProperty which is used for grouping.

ranges.description: Ranges into which the grouping values are divided

sortingValue.description:
Should the nodes be sorted by display label or the grouping property value. In most
cases the result is the same, unless `LabelOverride` rule is used to change the display label.
Defaults to `PropertyGroupingValue.DisplayLabel`.

Note: Sorting by property value only makes sense when instances are grouped by
property value as well.

Warning: Grouping by label and sorting by property value is not possible.

fromValue.description: Value that defines the range start (inclusive)

imageId.description: ID of an image to use for the grouping node. Defaults to `PropertyGroup.imageId` specified in `PropertyGroup`.

label.description:
Grouping node label. May be localized.
Defaults to `{from value} - {to value}`

toValue.description: Value that defines the range end (inclusive)

PropertySortingRule.description:
Rule to configure sorting for certain ECInstances in the hierarchy and/or content.
It is possible to configure different sorting for different types of ECInstances.

Multiple sorting rules may be applied for the same instances - in this case the
instances are first sorted by the highest priority rule and then the lower priority ones.

Note: This rule is not meant to be used to sort grouping nodes, custom nodes or
other non ECInstance type of nodes.

class.description:
Specification of ECClass whose ECInstances should be sorted by this rule.
Defaults to all classes in current context if not specified.

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order to execute it. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

isPolymorphic.description: Should `class` defined in this rule be handled polymorphically.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

propertyName.description: Name of the property which should be used for sorting

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

sortAscending.description: Will sort in ascending order if set to true, otherwise descending. Defaults to `true`.

PropertySpecification.description: Specification of an ECProperty and its overrides

categoryId.description: Identifier of a category that should be used for the property.

doNotHideOtherPropertiesOnDisplayOverrid.description:
Flag to control behavior of `isDisplayed` override when it's set to `true`.
By default, forcing property display hides all other properties.
Setting `doNotHideOtherPropertiesOnDisplayOverride` to `true` disables that behavior and
prevents forcing property display of one property from hiding other properties.

isDisplayed.description: Display override. `true` to force display, `false` to force hide, `undefined` to use default.

name.description:
Name of the ECProperty.

A `"*"` may be specified to match all properties in current context:
- when the specification is used in an ECClass context (e.g. in a `ContentModifier` rule),
   all properties of that class are matched (including properties derived from base classes, but excluding
   subclass properties).
- when specification is used outside of class context, all properties found in that context are matched. E.g. when
   used in `ContentSpecification.propertyOverrides` where `ContentSpecification` creates content with properties of
   different classes.

RelatedInstanceNodesSpecification.description:
Creates nodes for related instances of specified ECClasses.

Precondition: can be used only if parent node is ECInstance
node. If there is no immediate parent instance node it will go up until it finds one.

doNotSort.description:
Set this flag to `true` to suppress default sorting of ECInstances returned by this specification.

Note: setting this flag to `true` improves performance.

groupByClass.description: Group instances by ECClass. Defaults to `true`.

groupByLabel.description: Group instances by label. Defaults to `true`.

hasChildren.description:
This tells the rules engine that nodes produced using this
specification always or never have children. Defaults to `Unknown`.

Note: setting this flag to `Always` or `Never` improves performance.

hideExpression.description:
An ECExpression which
indicates whether a node should be hidden or not.

hideIfNoChildren.description: Hide nodes if they don't have children.

hideNodesInHierarchy.description:
Hide instance nodes provided by this specification and directly show nodes of its children.
This helps if you need to define related instance nodes of particular parent node that is not available in the
hierarchy.

instanceFilter.description:
Condition for filtering instances targeted by specified relationship paths.

See: ECExpressions Available in InstanceFilter

priority.description: Defines the order in which specifications are evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

relatedInstances.description: Specifications of related instances that can be used in nodes' creation.

relationshipPaths.description: Relationship paths from parent node instance class to child node instances' class.

suppressSimilarAncestorsCheck.description:
Suppress similar ancestor nodes' checking when creating nodes based on this specification.

By default we stop creating hierarchy at the node that has a similar ancestor representing
the same ECInstance and created using the same specification to prevent creating infinite
hierarchies. With this flag enabled, we allow up to 10 similar ancestors before we consider
the hierarchy infinite.

alias.description:
The alias to give for the joined related instance. Used to reference the related instance in
instance filter and customization rules.

**The value must be unique per-specification!**

isRequired.description:
Is the related instance required to exist. If yes, primary instance won't be returned
if the related instance doesn't exist. If not, primary instance will be returned, but related
instance will be null.

In SQL terms in can be compared to INNER JOIN vs OUTER JOIN.

relationshipPath.description: Relationship path to find the related instance.

RelatedPropertiesSpecification.description: Sub-specification to include additional related instance properties.

autoExpand.description:
Should field containing related properties be automatically expanded. This only takes effect when
content class is related to properties source class through a one-to-many or many-to-many relationship.

handleTargetClassPolymorphically.description:
Should the target class specified in `propertiesSource` be handled
polymorphically. This means properties of not only the target class, but also all its subclasses
are loaded.

properties.description:
A list of property names or specifications that should be included in the content. All
properties are included if this attribute is not specified.

propertiesSource.description: Relationship path from content class to properties' class.

relationshipMeaning.description: Meaning of the relationship which tells how to categorize the related properties. Defaults to `RelationshipMeaning.RelatedInstance`.

skipIfDuplicate.description: Should this related properties specification be ignored if it duplicates another higher priority specification for the same relationship.

RelationshipStepSpecification.description: Specification of a single relationship path step.

direction.description: Relationship direction that should be followed to find the target class.

relationship.description: Specification of the relationship to use for joining the related instance.

targetClass.description:
Specification of the target class. Either relationship's source or target class is used (based
on specified direction) if more specific target class is not specified by this attribute.

RepeatableRelationshipStepSpecification.description: Specification of a single relationship path step.

count.description:
Number of relationship steps that should be taken. Special `*` value means that
relationship is traversed recursively and all matching instances are accumulated.
Defaults to `1`.

direction.description: Relationship direction that should be followed to find the target class.

relationship.description: Specification of the relationship to use for joining the related instance.

targetClass.description:
Specification of the target class. Either relationship's source or target class is used (based
on specified direction) if more specific target class is not specified by this attribute.

RequiredSchemaSpecification.description: A specification for a schema requirement.

maxVersion.description:
Maximum allowed schema version (exclusive).
Format: `{read version}.{write version}.{minor version}`, e.g. `2.1.15`.

minVersion.description:
Minimum required schema version (inclusive).
Format: `{read version}.{write version}.{minor version}`, e.g. `2.1.15`.

RootCategoryIdentifier.description:
Identifier of the root category.

For direct properties it's the default category. See `DefaultPropertyCategoryOverride` for overriding the default category.

For related properties it's the category made up from the related ECClass defined by the first
`RelatedPropertiesSpecification` with `RelationshipMeaning.RelatedInstance`. If there's no such specification,
the default category is used.

RootNodeRule.description:
Root node rules define the nodes that are displayed
at the root hierarchy level.

autoExpand.description: Automatically expand nodes created by this rule.

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order to execute it. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

customizationRules.description:
Customization rules that are applied for the content returned by
this rule.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

specifications.description: Specifications that define what content the rule returns.

stopFurtherProcessing.description:
Stop processing rules that have lower priority. Used in cases when recursion
suppression is needed.

Note: If this flag is set, `specifications` and `subConditions` are not processed.

subConditions.description:
Specifies child node rules which are only used when specific condition
is satisfied.

SameLabelInstanceGroup.description:
Allows grouping multiple instances with the same label into one ECInstance node.
It can be used in cases when these instances represent the same object for the user.

When multiple instances are grouped, an ECInstance node is created instead of a
grouping node and the ECInstance key for the node is assigned to key of one of grouped
instances.

applicationStage.description:
Stage of hierarchy creation at which the rule is applied.
Defaults to `SameLabelInstanceGroupApplicationStage.Query`.

SelectedNodeInstancesSpecification.description:
Creates content for current selection.

Note: No data is returned for selected custom nodes.

acceptableClassNames.description:
Filter selected nodes by specified class names. All classes are
accepted if not specified.

acceptablePolymorphically.description:
Should `acceptableClassNames` property be checked polymorphically. If true, all derived
classes are accepted as well.

acceptableSchemaName.description:
Filter selected nodes by specified schema name. All schemas are
accepted if not specified.

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Identifies whether we should ignore this specification if there is already an existing specification
with higher `priority` that already provides content.

priority.description: Defines the order in which specifications are evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

propertyCategories.description:
Specifications for custom categories. Simply defining the categories does
nothing - they have to be referenced from `PropertySpecification` defined in
`propertyOverrides` by `id`.

relatedProperties.description: Specifications for including properties of related instances

showImages.description: Should each content record be assigned an image id

StringQuerySpecification.description: Specification which contains an ECSQL query used to query for instances.

class.description: Specification of ECClass whose instances the query returns.

StyleOverride.description:
Rule to override default node style and dynamically define a foreground/background
colors and a font style for a particular nodes.

backColor.description:
Background color that should be used for node. The value should be an ECExpression
whose result would evaluate to one the following formats:
- color name (`Red`, `Blue`, etc.)
- `rgb(255, 255, 255)`
- `#0F0F0F`

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order to execute it. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

fontStyle.description:
Font style that should be used for node. The value should be an ECExpression
whose result would evaluate to one the following values:
- `"Bold"`
- `"Italic"`
- `"Italic,Bold"`
- `"Regular"`

Defaults to `"FontStyle.Regular"`.

foreColor.description:
Foreground color that should be used for node. The value should be an ECExpression
whose result would evaluate to one the following formats:
- color name (`Red`, `Blue`, etc.)
- `rgb(255, 255, 255)`
- `#0F0F0F`

onlyIfNotHandled.description:
Should this rule should be ignored if there is already an existing
rule with a higher priority.

priority.description: Defines the order in which presentation rules will be evaluated and executed. Defaults to `1000`.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

SubCondition.description:
Defines child node specifications which should only be handled when a condition
is satisfied.

condition.description:
Defines a condition for the rule, which needs to be met in order to execute it. Condition
is an ECExpression, which can use
a limited set of symbols.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this rule. The rule is not used if the requirements are not met.

specifications.description: Child node specifications which are used if condition is satisfied

SupplementationInfo.description:
Contains supplementation-related information for
supplemental rulesets.

supplementationPurpose.description:
Identifies why supplementation is done and uniquely identifies particular supplemental ruleset.
There can be only one supplemental rule set with the same `Ruleset.id` and `supplementationPurpose`.

label.description:
Label of the variable that is shown in the UI.
May be localized.

VariablesGroup.description:
Presentation rules support variables that allow having additional customization of the hierarchy
and content based on variables whose values can change during application session.

There are special ECExpression symbols
that can be used to access variables by their ID, so rule conditions can check for a value and change
the behavior. It allows showing / hiding some nodes in the hierarchy, change the grouping, etc.

label.description:
Group label to display in the UI.
May be localized.

description:
Presentation ruleset is a list of rules that define tree hierarchy and content provided by
the presentation manager. The ruleset consists of:
- Ruleset options
- Navigation rules:
   - Root node rules
   - Child node rules
- Content rules for content you see in content controls
- Customization rules used for additional customizations such as styling, labeling, checkboxes, etc.
- User-controllable variables.

id.description: Ruleset identifier. This ID is used to bind UI components with the specific rule set.

requiredSchemas.description: Schema requirements for this ruleset. The ruleset is not used if the requirements are not met.

rules.description: Presentation rules used to create hierarchies and content

version.description:
Version of the presentation ruleset in SemVer format: `{major}.{minor}.{patch}`.

Setting the version is optional, but might be useful when ruleset is persisted
somewhere and evolves over time. Having a version helps choose persisting
strategy (keep all versions or only latest) and find the latest ruleset from a list
of ruleset with the same id.

Defaults to `0.0.0`.
